meanings.definition: A sign or symbol of something
meanings.sent1: The tokening of a heart represents love.
meanings.sent2: She kept the tokening of friendship in her pocket.
meanings.sent3: The tokening of a smile brightened his day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the tokening of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The tokening of a rainbow after the storm brought hope.

meanings.definition: Serving as a token or indication
meanings.sent1: The tokening gesture showed his appreciation.
meanings.sent2: Her tokening necklace held sentimental value.
meanings.sent3: The tokening handshake sealed the deal.
meanings.sent4: The tokening flag marked the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: His tokening smile reassured her during the presentation.

meanings.definition: To serve as a token or symbol of something
meanings.sent1: She was tokening her loyalty by wearing the family crest.
meanings.sent2: He was tokening his support by attending the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat was tokening its territory by rubbing against the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The painting tokening her memories hung proudly on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The tree tokening strength stood tall in the forest.
